#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Vevčani
#Text=Vevčani ( Macedonian : Вевчани ) is a village in western North Macedonia at the foot of the Jablanica Mountain .
#Text=Just east of the border with Albania , it is 14 kilometres ( 8.7 miles ) northwest of the town of Struga and Lake Ohrid .
#Text=It has nearly 2,500 inhabitants and is the only settlement within the Municipality of Vevčani .
#Text=The village sits in scenic mountainous terrain .
#Text=Much of Vevčani lies over 1,000 metres ( 3,200 feet ) above sea level .
#Text=Vevčani is known for its natural springs and scenery , its 1,400-year-old annual carnival , and its past attempts to become an independent republic .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Vevčani is surrounded by the Municipality of Struga , except on the west where it borders Albania .
#Text=It is the smallest municipality by area in the country outside of Greater Skopje .
#Text=The locals speak a unique dialect of Macedonian , found only in three other villages .
#Text=History
#Text=Vevčani was likely first inhabited around the time of the arrival of Slavs to the region .
#Text=Along with the rest of Macedonia , it was under Ottoman rule for five centuries until the Balkan Wars in the early 20th century .
#Text=Vevčani has long been a Christian village surrounded by Muslim villages .
#Text=The best known event in the village 's history involves the creation by residents of the Vevčani Republic .
#Text=In 1987 , the villagers defied attempts by Yugoslav authorities to redirect water from Vevčani 's springs to Struga .
#Text=The locals sparked calls for democracy and freedom from the Yugoslav government .
#Text=Following the breakup of Yugoslavia , the republic was declared on September 19 , 1991 .
#Text=It was not taken seriously , however , and the concept faded out .
#Text=It was revived in 2000 as a model country to attract tourism .
#Text=The Vevčani Republic has its own flag , coat of arms , and currency .
#Text=By car
#Text=The main way to get into Vevčani is off the Struga-Debar highway ( R1201 ) .
#Text=The road to the village is marked by a large gate with the village 's name and a church .
#Text=From this point , it is a 4 km ( 2.4 mi ) drive west to get to the village center .
#Text=Vevčani also has rural road connections with Gorna Belica to the southwest and Oktisi to the southeast .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Bus Station ( Вевчани Автобуска Cтаница ) .
#Text=Vevčani has a bus station with buses primarily going to Struga .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The village of Vevčani can be covered entirely on foot .
#Text=See
#Text=Vevčani Springs ( Вевчански Извори ) .
#Text=The main attraction to Vevčani is its natural springs .
#Text=The largest is situated at the opening of a cave , with about ten smaller springs beneath it .
#Text=The springs are situated at the western end of the village , sloping down from Jablanica Mountain .
#Text=The area is one large park with trails and area for picnicking .
#Text=Porta Vevčani ( Порта Вевчани ) .
#Text=The entrance to the village off the Struga-Debar highway is marked by a gate on which " ВЕВЧАНИ " is written .
#Text=The flag of the Vevčani Republic stands on the gate , while Macedonian flags stand and poles surrounding it .
#Text=A church dedicated to St George , built in 2013 , sits near the gate .
#Text=Church of St Nicholas ( Црква „ Свети Никола “ ) .
#Text=Construction on the church began in 1834 and was completed in 1862 .
#Text=The icons were made in 1867 , while the frescoes were done in 1879 .
#Text=Do
#Text=Vevčani Carnival - a carnival with a 15-century-long tradition every January 13th .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Accommodation of bigger tourist groups is done in hotels in Struga and , for individual tourists and smaller groups it is done in private houses in Vevčani .
